item.title: 东京地铁上市考验日股胃口
item.description: 东京地铁公司（Tokyo Metro Co., Ltd.）是世界上最大的地铁系统运营公司之一，作为六年来最大的一次上市，该公司的首次交易将考验日本股市的牛市行情。【原文：The trading debut of Tokyo Metro Co., which runs one of the world’s largest subway systems, will test the bull case for the Japanese stock market as its biggest listing in six years.】

item.title: 交易商消化美联储加息观点，黄金稳定在历史高位附近
item.description: 在上一交易日创下历史新高后，黄金走势趋于稳定，因为交易商消化了美联储官员对美国利率未来走势的不同看法。【原文：Gold steadied, after hitting a record high in the previous session, as traders digested differing views from Federal Reserve officials on the path forward for US interest rates.】

item.title: 中国恢复购买，澳大利亚葡萄酒出口跃升三分之一
item.description: 在中国取消关税后，澳大利亚对中国的葡萄酒出口量增加，从而使澳大利亚的葡萄酒出口量猛增三分之一以上。【原文：Australia’s wine exports jumped by more than a third, boosted by an increase in shipments to China after the Asian nation lifted tariffs.】

item.title: 前情人丑闻让科技大亨身家缩水 30 亿美元
item.description: 澳大利亚亿万富翁理查德-怀特（Richard White）被指控与女性有不当行为，他表示自己与风险的关系很轻松。【原文：Richard White, the Australian billionaire battling allegations of inappropriate behavior with women, has said he has a relaxed relationship with risk.】

item.title: 前台湾中央银行官员称政策 "混乱"、不明确
item.description: 一位前台湾央行官员批评岛内货币政策前后不一，指责台湾央行行长杨金龙未能明确传达政策意图，引发了市场波动。【原文：An ex-Taiwan central bank official criticized the island’s monetary policy as being inconsistent, blaming Governor Yang Chin-long for failing to communicate policy intentions clearly and sparking market volatility.】

item.title: 交易商继续关注中东问题，石油价格在暴涨后趋于平稳
item.description: 在周一飙升近 2% 之后，石油价格趋于稳定，因为交易商追踪中东的紧张局势，而更广泛的市场则呈现出风险厌恶的基调。【原文：Oil steadied — after surging almost 2% on Monday — as traders tracked tensions in the Middle East, and broader markets carried a risk-off tone.】

item.title: 中国紧张局势凸显台湾核淘汰计划的风险
item.description: 王伯伟 50 岁时开始在台湾第四座核电站工作，一路升迁，负责监督核电站的建设和最终运营。【原文：Wang Bo-whei was 50 years old when he started working at Taiwan’s fourth nuclear plant, rising through the ranks to oversee its construction and — he thought — its eventual operation.】

item.title: Meta 使用面部识别技术打击假冒名人的欺诈行为
item.description: Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms Inc. 将开始使用面部识别技术来打击利用名人照片使其看起来更合法的诈骗行为，这种策略被称为 "名人诱饵广告"。【原文：Facebook parent company Meta Platforms Inc. will start using facial recognition technology to crack down on scams that use pictures of celebrities to look more legitimate, a strategy referred to as “celeb-bait ads.”】

item.title: 亚洲股市将在华尔街下跌后下跌：市场综述
item.description: 由于华尔街股市在创下今年以来最长单周涨势后稍事喘息，大多数亚洲股市都将下跌。【原文：Most Asian shares were set for declines as Wall Street stocks took a breather after notching their longest weekly rally this year.】

item.title: 2025 年初食糖供应量将降至多年来最低水平
item.description: 据大宗商品交易商 Czarnikow Group Ltd.称，由于干旱阻碍了头号出口国巴西的生产，2025 年初全球食糖供应量将缩减至六年来的最低水平。【原文：Global sugar supplies are seen shrinking to the lowest level in six years in early 2025 as drought hampers production in top exporter Brazil, according to commodities trader Czarnikow Group Ltd.】

item.title: 酒店运营商 Aimbridge Hospitality 聘用顾问满足现金需求
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Aimbridge Hospitality 正在寻求 Evercore 公司的建议，因为这家第三方酒店管理公司希望充实其现金储备。【原文：Aimbridge Hospitality is getting advice from Evercore Inc. as the third-party hotel manager looks to shore up its cash reserves, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 首席执行官调查冲击股价

item.title: 体育画报》部门为可能的 Anytickets 交易寻求债务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，《体育画报》的二级票务市场正在寻求从直接贷款人那里筹集现金，以资助对另一家票务销售商 Anytickets.com 的潜在收购。【原文：Sports Illustrated’s secondary ticket marketplace is looking to drum up cash from direct lenders to fund a potential acquisition of Anytickets.com, another ticket seller, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本央行加息，"僵尸企业 "终将走向破产
item.description: 在实行了三十年的超宽松货币政策后，日本央行即使是小幅加息，也会助长可能陷入破产的僵尸企业数量的增加。【原文：After three decades of ultra-loose monetary policy, even small hikes in interest rates by the Bank of Japan are poised to fuel an increase in the number of zombie companies that could be tipped into insolvency.】

item.title: 马斯克因 Robotaxi 亮相时出现 "银翼杀手 "图像而遭起诉
item.description: 好莱坞电影制片人 Alcon Entertainment 起诉埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk），称特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Hollywood filmmaker Alcon Entertainment is suing Elon Musk, saying Tesla Inc. used imagery inspired by the 2017 movie Blade Runner 2049 at a recent event even after permission was denied.】

item.title: 新西兰主权基金晋升两位经理为联合首席信息官
item.description: 新西兰主权财富基金提升了两位高级经理，从 12 月初开始担任联席首席投资官。【原文：New Zealand’s sovereign wealth fund has promoted two senior managers to be joint chief investment officers from early December.】

item.title: 交易员在美国大选前减少美元看跌押注
item.description: 全年都在看涨和看跌美元之间徘徊的货币投机交易商们，刚刚在美国大选前采取了三年来最大的行动。【原文：Speculative currency traders who vacillated all year between bullish and bearish views on the dollar just made their biggest move in three years ahead of the US election.】

item.title: 传统客户转向 SAP 云服务，本季度收入增长 25
item.description: SAP SE 表示，由于欧洲最大的软件公司推动客户从本地安装的传统系统转型，该公司第三季度的云收入增长了 25%。【原文：SAP SE said its cloud revenue grew by 25% in the third quarter, as Europe’s biggest software company pushed customers to transition away from locally-installed legacy systems.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会将加强对经纪人和顾问使用的人工智能工具的审查
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会的审查人员明年将加强对金融公司使用人工智能的审查，这是监管机构对新兴技术日益关注的最新迹象。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission’s examiners will step up scrutiny of financial firms’ use of artificial intelligence next year, the latest sign of regulators’ growing concerns about the emerging technologies.】

item.title: 私人信贷在澳大利亚高利率环境下蓬勃发展
item.description: 澳大利亚的一些大型机构投资者正在新生的本地私人债务市场寻求增长，以利用高利率和银行回避高风险贷款的机会。【原文：Some of Australia’s large institutional investors are looking for growth in the nascent local private debt market to take advantage of elevated interest rates and as banks shy away from riskier lending.】

item.title: 达成出租人协议后，Azul 在债务出售方面举步维艰
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Azul SA 筹集 4 亿美元新债的努力遇到了阻碍，这家陷入困境的巴西航空公司急于筹集所需现金，以满足其与飞机租赁商达成的协议中的一个关键条件。【原文：Azul SA’s efforts to raise $400 million in fresh debt have hit a snag, with the troubled Brazilian airline rushing to raise the cash it needs to meet a key condition of its deal with aircraft lessors, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特许金融分析师协会研究人工智能对测试和课程的影响
item.description: 管理特许金融分析师认证的特许金融分析师协会正在研究人工智能如何改进其产品和考试，该协会的平均通过率约为 50%。【原文：The CFA Institute, which manages the chartered financial analyst certification, is looking into how artificial intelligence could improve its products and exams, which have an average pass rate of around 50%.】

item.title: 财政部弗罗斯特称回购改善了旧债券的流动性
item.description: 美国财政部负责金融市场事务的助理部长约书亚-弗罗斯特（Joshua Frost）周一表示，5月下旬开始的美国国债回购已经开始改善旧票据和债券市场的流动性。【原文：The US Treasury debt buybacks that began in late May have begun to improve liquidity in the market for older notes and bonds, Joshua Frost, the Treasury Department’s assistant secretary for financial markets, said Monday.】

item.title: 安桥公司将在管道股权出售潮中与原住民组织对话
item.description: Enbridge 公司邀请加拿大原住民社区商讨一项金融合作计划，该计划类似于早些时候向原住民社区出售 11.2 亿加元（8.09 亿美元）的部分管道股份。【原文：Enbridge Inc. invited indigenous communities in Canada to discuss a financial partnership similar to an earlier C$1.12 billion ($809 million) sale of a stake in some of its pipelines to such groups.】

item.title: 穆巴达拉即将达成收购医疗科技公司 Zelis 股份的交易
item.description: 知情人士透露，穆巴达拉投资公司（Mubadala Investment Co.【原文：Mubadala Investment Co. is nearing a deal to acquire a minority stake in Zelis that values the health-care technology company at about $17 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 高通公司发布新型智能手机芯片，转向自主设计
item.description: 高通公司发布了一款功能更强大的处理器，旨在为智能手机带来笔记本电脑级别的功能，帮助这些终端利用新的人工智能工具。【原文：Qualcomm Inc. unveiled a more powerful processor that’s designed to bring laptop-level capabilities to smartphones, helping the devices take advantage of new artificial intelligence tools.】

item.title: Stripe 确认收购稳定币平台 Bridge 的计划
item.description: Stripe Inc.联合创始人兼首席执行官帕特里克-科里森（Patrick Collison）在周一的一篇 X 帖子中证实，该支付公司计划收购稳定币初创公司 Bridge。【原文：Stripe Inc. co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Patrick Collison confirmed in a X post on Monday that the payments company plans to buy stablecoin startup Bridge.】

item.title: 英孚赫顿因合伙人解决法律纠纷而解散
item.description: 英富哈顿（EF Hutton）是华尔街的一个传奇名字，它曾是一家领先的 SPAC 投资银行，但在重振该品牌的两个合伙人同意撤销对彼此的诉讼并分道扬镳后，该品牌即将解体。【原文：EF Hutton, the storied Wall Street name that was reborn as a leading SPAC investment bank, is breaking up after the two partners that revived the brand agreed to drop lawsuits against each other and go their own ways.】

item.title: Blackstone、Apollo 加紧追逐投资级贷款
item.description: 昨天，他们还在处理不良债务，今天，他们就在努力建立作为普通贷款人的信誉。【原文：Yesterday they dealt in distressed debt, today they’re battling to establish credibility as plain-vanilla lenders.】
